hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5040
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Aishah that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "Ten things are part of the Fitrah: Trimming the mustache, trimming the nails, washing the joints, letting the beard grow, using the Siwak, rinsing the nose, plucking the armpit hairs, shaving the pubes, and washing with water (after relieving oneself)." Mus'ab bin Shaibah said: "I have forgotten the tenth, unless it was rinsing the mouth."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5041
hadith_list.narrator: Al-Mu'tamir narrated that his father said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard Talq mentioning ten things that have to do with the Fitrah: Using the Siwak, trimming the mustache, clipping the nails, washing the joints, shaving the pubes, rinsing the nose, and I am not sure about rinsing the mouth."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5042
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Talq bin Habib said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Ten things are from the Sunnah: Using the Siwak, trimming the mustache, rinsing the mouth, rinsing the nose, letting the beard grow, trimming the nails, plucking the armpit hairs, circumcision, shaving the pubes and washing one's backside."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5043
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'Five things are of the Fitrah: Circumcision, shaving the pubes, plucking the armpit hair, clipping the nails and trimming the mustache.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5044
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Five things are of the Fitrah: Clipping the nails, trimming the mustache, plucking the armpit hairs, shaving the pubes, and circumcision." (Sahih Mawquf)

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5045
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn 'Umar:
hadith_list.english_text: That the Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "Trim the mustache and let the beard grow."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5046
hadith_list.narrator: Ibn 'Umar said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'Let the beard grow and trim the mustache.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5047
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Zaid bin Al-Arqam said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard the Messenger of Allah [SAW] say: 'Whoever does not take from his mustache, he is not one of us.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5048
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn 'Umar that :
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] saw a boy, part of whose head had been shaven and part had been left. He forbade that and said: "Shave all of it, or leave all of it."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5049
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Ali:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade women to shave their heads."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5050
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Abdullah bin 'Umar that :
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] said: "Allah, the Mighty and Sublime, has forbidden me from Al-Qaza' (to shave part of the head and leave part)."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5051
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Al-Qaza' (to shave part of the head and leave part)."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5052
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Wa'il bin Hujr said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I came to the Prophet [SAW] and I had hair. He said: 'This is bad,' and I thought he meant me, so I cut my hair then I came to him. He said to me: 'I didn't mean you, but this is better.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5053
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The hair of the Prophet [SAW] was wavy, neither curly nor straight, and (hung down) between his ears and his shoulders."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5054
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Humaid bin 'Abdur-Rahman Al-Himyari said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I met a man who accompanied the Prophet [SAW] as Abu Hurairah accompanied him for four years, who said: 'The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade us from combing our hair everyday.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5055
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Abdullah bin Mughaffal said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade combing one's hair, except every other day."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5056
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Al-Hasan that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] forbade coming one's hair except every other day.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5057
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Al-Hasan and Muhammad said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Combing one's hair (should be done) every other day."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5058
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Abdullah bin Shaqiq said:
hadith_list.english_text: "One of the Companions of the Prophet [SAW] was a governor in Egypt, and one of his companions came to him and found him with unkempt, wild hair. He said: 'How come I see you with wild hair when you are a governor?' He said: 'The Prophet of Allah [SAW] forbade us from Al-Irfah,' and we said: 'What is Al-Irfah?' He said: 'To comb your hair every day.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5059
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Aishah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] used to like to start in the right. He would accept with his right hand and give with his right hand, and he liked to start on the right in all his affairs."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5060
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Al-Bara' said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I have never seen anyone who looked more handsome in a red Hullah than the Messenger of Allah [SAW], with his long hair that came down to his shoulders."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5061
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The hair of the Messenger of Allah [SAW] came halfway down his ears."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5062
hadith_list.narrator: Al-Bara' said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I have never seen any man more handsome in a red Hullah than the Messenger of Allah [SAW]." He said: "And I saw his long hair, coming almost to his shoulders."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5063
hadith_list.narrator: 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud said:
hadith_list.english_text: "According to whose recitation do you want me to recite? Because I recited seventy-odd Surahs to the Messenger of Allah [SAW] when Zaid had two braids, and was playing with the other boys."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5064
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Wa'il said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Ibn Mas'ud addressed us and said: 'How do you want me to recite? According to the recitation of Zaid bin Thabit, when I learned seventy-odd Surahs from the mouth of the Messenger of Allah [SAW] while Zaid was with the other boys with two braids?'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5065
hadith_list.narrator: Ziyad bin Al-Husain narrated that his father said:
hadith_list.english_text: "When he came to the Prophet [SAW] in Al-Madinah, the Messenger of Allah [SAW] said to him: 'Come closer to me.' So he came closer to him, and he put his hand on his braid and wiped his head and prayed for him."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5066
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Wa'il bin Hujr said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I came to the Prophet [SAW] and I had long hair. He said: 'It is not good,' and I thought he meant me, so I went and cut my hair. He said: 'I did not mean you, but this is better.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5067
hadith_list.narrator: Ruwaifi' bin Thabit said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'O Ruwaifi', you may live for a long time after me, so tell the people that whoever ties up his beard, or twists it, or hangs an amulet, or cleans himself (after relieving himself) with animal dung or bones, Muhammad has nothing to do with him.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5068
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Amr bin Shu'aib, from his father, from his grandfather, that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade plucking gray hairs.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5069
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "The Jews and Christians do not dye their hair, so be different from them."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5070
hadith_list.narrator: Narrated from Abu Hurairah:
hadith_list.english_text: A similar report was narrated from Abu Hurairah, from the Messenger of Allah [SAW].

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5071
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'The Jews and the Christians do not dye their hair, so be different from them and dye your hair.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5072
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] said: "The Jews and Christians do not dye their hair, so be different from them."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5073
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'Change gray hair, but do not imitate the Jews.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5074
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Az-Zubair said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'Change gray hair but do not imitate the Jews.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5075
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibn 'Abbas, who attributed it to the Prophet [SAW], said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Some people will dye their hair black like the breasts of pigeons at the end of time, but they will not even smell the fragrance of Paradise."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5076
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Jabir said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Abu Quhafah was brought on the Day of the Conquest of Makkah, and his hair and beard were white like the Thaghamah. The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'Change this with something, but avoid black.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5077
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Dharr that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] said: "The best things with which you can change gray hair are Henna and Katam."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5078
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Dharr said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'The best things with which you can change gray hair are Henna and Katam.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5079
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Dharr said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard the Prophet [SAW] say: 'Some of the best things with which you can change gray hair are Henna and Katam.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5080
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Dharr said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'The best things with which you can change gray hair are Henna and Katam.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5081
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Abdullah bin Buraidah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'The best things with which you can change gray hair are Henna and Katam.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5082
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Abdullah bin Buraidah that:
hadith_list.english_text: He heard that the Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "The best things with which you can change gray hair are Henna and Katam."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5083
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Rimthah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "My father and I came to the Prophet [SAW] and he had dyed his beard with Henna."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5084
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Rimthah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I came to the Prophet [SAW] and I saw that he had dyed his beard with yellow dye."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5085
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Zaid bin Aslam said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I saw Ibn 'Umar dyeing his beard yellow with Khaluq and I said: 'O Abu 'Abdur-Rahman, are you dyeing your beard yellow with Khaluq?' He said: 'I saw the Messenger of Allah [SAW] dyeing his beard yellow with it, and there was no other kind of dye that was dearer to him than this. He used to dye all of his clothes with it, even his 'Imamah (turban).'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5086
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Qatadah :
hadith_list.english_text: That he asked Anas: "Did the Messenger of Allah [SAW] dye his hair? He said: "His gray hair didn't go far, it was only a little at his temples."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5087
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Anas that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] did not dye his hair; his gray hair were only a little beneath his lower lip and at his temples, and a little on his head.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5088
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet of Allah [SAW] disliked ten things: Yellow dye, meaning Khaluq, changing gray hair, dragging one's Izar, wearing gold rings, playing with dice (Ki'ab), (a woman) showing her adornment to people to whom it is not permissible for her to show it, reciting Ruqyah, unless it is with Al-Mu'awidhat (Verses seeking refuge with Allah), hanging amulets, removing to ejaculate in other than the right place, and taking away the milk of an infant boy (by having intercourse with his mother)- but he did not say that this is Haram.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5089
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Aishah that:
hadith_list.english_text: A woman reached out her hand (to give) a letter to the Prophet [SAW], and he withdrew his hand. She said: "O Messenger of Allah, I reached out my hand (to give you) a letter and you did not take it." He said: "I did not know whether it was the hand of a woman or a man." She said: "It is the hand of a woman." He said: "If you were a woman, you would change your nails (by dyeing them with Henna)."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5090
hadith_list.narrator: Karimah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard a woman asking 'Aishah about dyeing the hair with Henna. She said: 'There is nothing wrong with it, but I do not like to do it because my beloved- meaning the Prophet [SAW]- disliked its smell.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5091
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Al-Husain Al-Haitham bin Shufayy that he said:
hadith_list.english_text: "A friend of mine who was called Abu 'Amir, from Al-Ma'afir, and I went out to pray in Jerusalem. Their preacher was a man from (the tribe of) Azd who was called Abu Raihanah, one of the Companions." Abu Al-Husain said: "My companion reached the Masjid before I did, then I caught up with him, and sat beside him. He said: 'Have you heard the preaching of Abu Raihanah?' I said: 'No.' He said: 'I heard him say: 'The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade ten things: Filing (the teeth), tattoos, plucking (hair), for two men to lie under one cover with no barrier between them, for two women to lie under one cover with no barrier between them, for a man to add more than four fingers' width of silk to the bottom of his garment like the foreigners (Persians), (and he forbade) plundering, riding (while sitting on) leopard skins and wearing rings- except for rulers."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5092
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Sa'eed bin Al-Musayyab that Mu'awiyah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade giving a false impression."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5093
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Sa'eed Al-Maqburi said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I saw Mu'awiyah bin Abi Sufyan on the Minbar, holding a ball of hair such as women use. He said: "What is wrong with Muslim women who put such things (on their heads)? I heard the Messenger of Allah [SAW] say: "Any woman who adds hair to her head that is not hers, it is something false, that she is adding to her head."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5094
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Hisham bin 'Urwah, from his wife Fatimah, from Asma' bint Abi Bakr, that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] cursed the woman who affixes hair extensions and the woman who has that done.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5095
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] cursed the woman who affixes hair extensions and the woman who has that done, the woman who does tattoos and the woman who has that done."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5096
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Nafi' that he heard that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] cursed the woman who affixes hair extensions and the woman who has that done, the woman who does tattoos and the woman who has that done.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5097
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Safiyyah bint Shaibah, that 'Aishah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'May Allah curse the woman who affixes hair extensions and the woman who has that done.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5098
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Masruq that:
hadith_list.english_text: A woman came to 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud and said: "I am a woman with little hair, is it alright for me to add extensions to my hair?" He said: "No." She said: "Is it something that you heard from the Messenger of Allah [SAW] or that you find in the Book of Allah?" He said: "No, rather I heard it from the Messenger of Allah [SAW] and I find it in the Book of Allah." And he quoted the Hadith.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5099
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Abdullah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] cursed the women who do tattoos and the women who have them done, Al-Mutanammisat, and the women who have their teeth separated for the sake of beauty, those who change (the creation of Allah.)"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5100
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibrahim said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Abdullah said: 'The women who have their teeth separated..." and he quoted the Hadith.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5101
hadith_list.narrator: Aban bin Sam'ah narrated that his mother said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard 'Aishah say: 'The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade the woman who does tattoos and the woman who has that done, the woman who affixes hair extensions and the woman who has that done, An-Namisah (the one who does the plucking) and Al-Mutanammisah (the one who has it done).'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5102
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Abdullah bin Murrah, from Al-Harith, from 'Abdullah, who said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The one who consumes Riba, the one who pays it, and the one who writes it down, if they know that it is Riba; the woman who does tattoos and the woman who has that done for the purpose of beautification; the one who withholds Sadaqah (Zakah); and the one who reverts to the life of a Bedouin after having emigrated- they will (all) be cursed upon the tongue of Muhammad [SAW] on the Day of Resurrection."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5103
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Husain, Mughirah, and Ibn 'Awn, from Ash-Sh'abi, from Al-Harith, from 'Ali, that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] cursed the one who consumes Riba, the one who pays it, the one who writes it down, and the one who withholds Sadaqah (Zakah). And he used to forbid wailing (in mourning for the dead).

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5104
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn 'Awn, from Ash-Sha'bi, from Al-Harith, who said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] cursed the one who consumes Riba, the one who pays it, the one who writes it down and the one who witnesses it; the woman who does tattoos and the woman who has that done"- he said: "Unless it is done as a remedy;" he said: "Yes"- "the man who married a woman in order to divorce her so that she may go back to her first husband and the man (the first husband) for whom that is done; and the one who withholds Sadaqah (Zakah). And he used to forbid wailing (in mourning), but he did not say 'cursed'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5105
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that from 'Ata' bin As-Sa'ib, from Ash-Sha'bi who said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] cursed the one who consumes Riba, the one who pays it, the one who witnesses it and the one who writes it down; the woman who does tattoos and the woman who has that done; and forbade wailing (in mourning), but he did not say that its doer is cursed."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5106
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "A woman who did tattoos was brought to 'Umar and he said: 'I adjure you by Allah, did any one among you hear (anything from) the Messenger of Allah [SAW]?' Abu Hurairah said: "I stood up and said: 'O Commander of the Believers! I heard him (say something).' He said: 'What did you hear?' I said: 'I heard him say: Do not do tattoos and do not have tattoos done.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5107
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibn Mas'ud said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard the Messenger of Allah [SAW] cursing Al-Mutanammisat, women who have their teeth separated, and women who have tattoos done, those who change the creation of Allah, the Mighty and Sublime."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5108
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Abdullah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard the Messenger of Allah [SAW] cursing Al-Mutanammisat, women who have their teeth separated, and women who have tattoos done, those who change the creation of Allah, the Mighty and Sublime."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5109
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Abdullah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard the Messenger of Allah [SAW] say: 'May Allah curse Al-Mutanammisat, women who have tattoos done and women who have their teeth separated, those who change the creation of Allah, Mighty and Sublime."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5110
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Al-Husain Al-Himyari that :
hadith_list.english_text: He and a companion of his used to stay with Abu Raihanah to learn good things from him. He said: "One day my companion came and told me that he heard Abu Raihanah say: 'The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade filing (the teeth), tattoos, and plucking hairs.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5111
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Raihanah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "We heard that the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade filing (the teeth) and tattoos."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5112
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Raihanah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "We heard that the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade filing (the teeth) and tattoos."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5113
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn 'Abbas that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "One of the best kinds of kohl that you use is Ithmid (antimony); it brightens the vision and makes the hair (eye-lashes) grow."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5114
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Simak said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard Jabir bin Samurah being asked about the gray hairs of the Prophet [SAW]. He said: 'If he put oil on his head they could not be seen, but if he did not put oil on his head, they could be seen.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5115
hadith_list.narrator: 'Abdullah bin Zaid narrated from his father that:
hadith_list.english_text: Ibn 'Umar used to dye his garments with saffron. He was asked about that and he said: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] used to dye his clothes (with it)."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5116
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Muhammad bin 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I asked 'Aishah: 'Did the Messenger of Allah [SAW] wear perfume?' She said: 'Yes, the perfumes used by men: Musk and amber.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5117
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'The perfume for men is that whose scent is apparent while its color is hidden, and the perfume for women is that whose color is apparent, while its scent is hidden.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5118
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] said: "The perfume for men is that whose scent is apparent while its color is hidden, and the perfume for women is that whose color is apparent, while its scent is hidden."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5119
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'A woman from among the Children of Israel took a ring of gold and filled it with musk.' The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'That is the best kind of perfume.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5120
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "A man came to the Prophet [SAW] wearing a little dab of Khaluq." The Prophet [SAW] said to him: 'Go and scrub it off.' Then he came (again) and he said: 'Go and scrub it off.' Then he came to him (again) and he said: 'Go and scrub it off, and don't put it on again.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5121
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ya'la bin Murrah that:
hadith_list.english_text: He passed by the Prophet [SAW] wearing Khaluq. He said to him: "Do you have a wife?" I said: "No." He said: "Wash it off, then wash it off, then do not put it on again."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5122
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ya'la bin Murrah that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] saw a man wearing Khaluq and said: "Go and wash it off, then wash it off, and do not put it on again."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5123
hadith_list.narrator: Narrated from Ibn 'Amr:
hadith_list.english_text: A similar report was narrated from Ibn 'Amr, from a man, from Ya'la.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5124
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ya'la bin Murrah Ath-Thaqafi said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] saw me wearing a little dab of Khaluq. He said: 'O Ya'la, do you have a wife?' I said: 'No.' He said: 'Wash it off and do not put it on again, then wash it off and do not put it on again, then wash it off and do not put it on again.' I said: 'So I washed it off, and did not put it on again, then I washed it off and did not put it on again, then I washed it off, and did not put it on again."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5125
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ya'la said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I passed by the Messenger of Allah [SAW] and I was wearing Khaluq. He said: 'O Ya'la, do you have a wife?' I said: 'No.' He said: 'Go and wash it off, then wash it off, then wash it off, and do not put it on again.' So I went and washed it off, then washed it off, then washed it off, and I did not put it on again."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5126
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Al-Ash'ari said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'Any woman who puts on perfume then passes by people so that they can smell her fragrance then she is an adulteress.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5127
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'If a woman goes out to the Masjid, let her perform Ghusl to remove perfume as she would perform Ghusl to remove Janabah (impurity following sexual activity).'" This is an abridged form of it.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5128
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'If a woman has perfumed herself with incense, let her not attend 'Isha' prayer.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5129
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Zainab, the wife of 'Abdullah, said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'If one of you wants to attend 'Isha' prayer, let her not touch perfume.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5130
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Zainab, the wife of 'Abdullah, said:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "If one of you wants to attend 'Isha' prayer, let her not touch perfume."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5131
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Zainab Ath-Thaqafiyyah that :
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet of Allah [SAW] said: "If any one of you goes out to the Masjid, let her not go near perfume."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5132
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Zainab Ath-Thaqafiyyah, the wife of 'Abdullah, that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] told her not to touch perfume if she wanted to go out to 'Isha' the later.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5133
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Zainab Ath-Thaqafiyyah that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "If a woman goes out to (pray) 'Isha', let her not touch perfume."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5134
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Zainab Ath-Thaqafiyyah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'If one of you wants to attend the prayer, let her not touch perfume.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5135
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Nafi' said:
hadith_list.english_text: "When Ibn 'Umar burned incense he would burn Al-Uluwwah that was not mixed with anything else, or camphor mixed with some Al-Uluwwah. Then he said: 'This is what the Messenger of Allah [SAW] used to burn.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5136
hadith_list.narrator: 'Uqbah bin 'Amir narrated that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] used to tell his wives not to wear jewelry and silk. He said: "If you want the jewelry and silk of Paradise, then do not wear them in this world."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5137
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Rib'i, from his wife, that the sister of Hudhaifah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] addressed us and said: 'O women, do you not have any silver to wear for adornment? For there is no woman among you who wears gold and shows it, but she will be punished because of it.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5138
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Rib'i, from his wife, that the sister of Hudhaifah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] addressed us and said: 'O women, do you not have any silver to wear for adornment? For there is no woman among you who wears gold and shows it, but she will be punished because of it.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5139
hadith_list.narrator: Asma' bint Yazid narrated that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "Any woman who puts on a necklace of gold, Allah will put something similar of fire around her neck. Any woman who puts earrings of gold on her ears, Allah, the Mighty and Sublime, will put earrings of fire on her ears on the Day of Resurrection."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5140
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Asma' Ar-Rahabi that Thawban, the freed slave of the Messenger of Allah [SAW], told him:
hadith_list.english_text: "Fatimah bint Hubairah came to the Messenger of Allah [SAW] with a big ring on her hand." He (the narrator) said: "This is what I found in the book of my father, a huge ring."- "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] started hitting her hand, so she entered upon Fatimah, the daughter of the Messenger of Allah [SAW], and complained to her about what the Messenger of Allah [SAW] had done. Fatimah took off a gold chain from her neck and said: 'This was given to me by Abu Hasan.' The Messenger of Allah [SAW] came in and (ï·º) the chain in her hand. He said: 'O Fatimah, would you like the people to say that the daughter of the Messenger of Allah [SAW] has a chain of fire in her hand?' Then he went out, without sitting down. Fatimah sent the chain to the market and sold it, and she bought a slave with the money, and set him free. He was told of that and he said: 'Praise be to Allah, Who has saved Fatimah from the Fire.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5141
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Thawban said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The daughter of Hubairah came to the Messenger of Allah [SAW] and on her hand were large gold rings." - a similar report.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5142
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I was sitting with the Prophet [SAW] when a woman came to him and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, two bracelets of gold.' He said: 'Two bracelets of fire.' She said: 'O Messenger of Allah, a necklace of gold.' He said: 'A necklace of fire.' She said: 'Two earrings of gold.' He said: 'Two earrings of fire.' She was wearing two bracelets of gold, so she took them off and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, if a woman does not adorn herself for her husband, she will become unattractive to him.' He said: 'What is there to keep any one of you from making earrings of silver and painting them yellow with saffron or some 'Abir'?' This is the wording of Ibn Harb.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5143
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Aishah that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] saw her wearing two bracelets of gold. The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "Shall I not tell you of something that is better than this? Why don't you take these off and wear two bracelets of silver, and paint them yellow with saffron, and they will look fine.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5144
hadith_list.narrator: 'Ali bin Abi Talib said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet of Allah [SAW] took hold of some silk in his right hand and some gold in his left, then he said: 'These two are forbidden for the males of my Ummah.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5145
hadith_list.narrator: 'Ali bin Abi Talib said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet of Allah [SAW] took hold of some silk in his right hand, and some gold in his left, then he said: 'These two are forbidden for the males of my Ummah.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5146
hadith_list.narrator: 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet of Allah [SAW] took hold of some silk in his right hand, and some gold in his left, then he said: 'These two are forbidden for the males of my Ummah.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5147
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Abdullah bin Zurair Al-Ghafiqi said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard 'Ali say: 'The Messenger of Allah [SAW] took some gold in his right hand and some silk in his left hand and said: This is forbidden for the males of my Ummah.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5148
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Musa that :
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "Gold and silk have been permitted for the females of my Ummah, and forbidden to the males."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5149
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Mu'awiyah that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade wearing silk and gold, unless it was broken (into smaller pieces).

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5150
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Mu'awiyah that :
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade wearing gold unless it was broken (into smaller pieces), and (he forbade) riding on Al-Mayathir.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5151
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Shaikh that he heard Mu'awiyah say,:
hadith_list.english_text: When a group of the Companions of Muhammad [SAW] were with him: "Do you know that the Prophet of Allah [SAW] forbade wearing gold unless it was broken (into smaller pieces)?" They said: "By Allah, yes."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5152
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Shaikh said:
hadith_list.english_text: "While we were with Mu'awiyah on one of his pilgrimages, he gathered together a group of the Companions of Muhammad [SAW] and said to them: 'Do you not know that the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade wearing gold unless it was broken (into smaller pieces)?' They said: 'By Allah, yes.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5153
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Himman:
hadith_list.english_text: That when Mu'awiyah went on Hajj, he gathered together a group of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah [SAW] at the Ka'bah and said to them: "I adjure you by Allah, did the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbid wearing gold?" They said: "Yes." He said: "And I bear witness to that."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5154
hadith_list.narrator: Abu Shaikh narrated from his brother Himman:
hadith_list.english_text: That when Mu'awiyah went on Hajj, he gathered together a group of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah [SAW] at the Ka'bah and said to them: "I adjure you by Allah, did the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbid wearing gold?" They said: "Yes." He said: "And I bear witness to that."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5155
hadith_list.narrator: Himman said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Mu'awiyah went on Hajj and he called a group of Ansar to the Ka'bah. He said: 'I adjure you by Allah, did you hear the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbid gold?' They said: 'Yes.' He said: 'And I bear witness to that.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5156
hadith_list.narrator: Himman said:
hadith_list.english_text: Mu'awiyah went on Hajj and he called a group of Ansar to the Ka'bah. He said: 'I adjure you by Allah, did you hear the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbid gold?' They said: 'Yes.' He said: 'And I bear witness to that.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5157
hadith_list.narrator: Ibn Himman said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Mu'awiyah went on Hajj and he called a group of Ansar to the Ka'bah. He said: 'Did you hear the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbid gold?' They said: 'Yes.' He said: 'And I bear witness to that.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5158
hadith_list.narrator: Himman said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Mu'awiyah went on Hajj and he called a group of Ansar to the Ka'bah. He said: 'I adjure you by Allah, did you hear the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbid gold?' They said: 'Yes.' He said: 'And I bear witness to that.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5159
hadith_list.narrator: Abu Shaikh Al-Huna'i said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard Mu'awiyah say to a group of Muhajirun and Ansar who were around him: 'Do you know that the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade wearing silk?' They said: 'By Allah, yes.' He said 'And (he forbade) wearing gold unless it was broken (into smaller pieces)?' They said: 'Yes.'" 'Ali bin Ghurab contradicted him; he reported it from Bahais, from Abu Shaikh, from Ibn 'Umar.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5160
hadith_list.narrator: Abu Shaikh said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard Ibn 'Umar say: 'The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade wearing gold unless it is broken (into smaller pieces).'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5161
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Arafah bin As'ad that:
hadith_list.english_text: His nose was cut off at the battle of Al-Kulab during the Jahiliyyah, so he wore a nose made of silver, but it began to rot, so the Prophet [SAW] told him to wear a nose made of gold.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5162
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Abdur-Rahman bin Tarafah, from 'Arafah bin As'ad bin Karib, who was his grandfather- saying that he saw his grandfather, and he said:
hadith_list.english_text: "His nose had been cut off at the battle of Al-Kulab during the Jahiliyyah, so he wore a nose made of silver, but it began to rot on him, so the Prophet [SAW] told him to wear a nose made of gold."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5163
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Sa'eed bin Al-Musayyab said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Umar said to Suhaib: 'Why do I see you wearing a ring of gold?' He said: 'One who was better than you saw it and did not criticize it.' He said: 'Who was that?' He said: 'The Messenger of Allah [SAW].'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5164
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] started to wear a gold ring, and the people started to wear gold rings. The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'I was wearing this ring, but I will never wear it again.' He threw it away and the people threw their rings away.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5165
hadith_list.narrator: 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet [SAW] forbade me to wear gold rings and Al-Qassi, red Al-Miyathir, and (to drink) Al-Ji'ah.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5166
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet [SAW] forbade me to wear gold rings, and Al-Qassi, red Al-Miyathir."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5167
hadith_list.narrator: 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade gold rings, red Al-Miyathir, Qassiyah garments and Al-Ji'ah, which is a drink made from barley and wheat." - And he mentioned its strength.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5168
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me (to wear) gold rings and Al-Qassi, Al-Mitharah, and Al-Ji'ah."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5169
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Sa'sa'ah bin Suwhan said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I said to 'Ali: 'Forbid to us that which the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade to you.' He said: 'He forbade me from Ad-Dubba', Al-Hantam, gold circles (rings), wearing silk, and Al-Qassi, and red Al-Mitharah.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5170
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Malik bin 'Umair said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Sa'sa'ah bin Suwhan came to 'Ali and said: 'Forbid to us from that which the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade to you.' He said: 'He forbade us from Ad-Dubba', Al-Hantam, An-Naqir, Al-Ji'ah, and he forbade us from gold circles (rings), wearing silk, and wearing Al-Qassi, and red Al-Mitharah.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5171
hadith_list.narrator: Sa'sa'ah bin Suwhan said to 'Ali:
hadith_list.english_text: "O Commander of the Believers! Forbid us from that which the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade you from." He said: "He forbade us from Ad-Dubba, Al-Hantam, Al-Ji'ah, and from gold circles (rings), and from wearing silk, and from red Al-Mitharah."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5172
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "My beloved, the Messenger of Allah [SAW], forbade me three things but I do not say that he forbade them to the people. He forbade me from wearing rings of gold, from wearing Al-Qassi, and Al-Mu'asfar Al-Mufaddam (garments that are deeply dyed with safflower), and (he forbade me) from reciting Qur'an when prostrating or bowing." He was followed (in that narration) by Ad-Dahhak bin 'Uthman.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5173
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me- but I do not say that he forbade you- from wearing rings of gold, and from wearing Al-Qassi, and from wearing Al-Mufaddam (garments dyed deep red) and Al-Mu'asfar (garments dyed with safflower), and from reciting Qur'an while bowing."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5174
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibrahim that his father told him that he heard 'Ali say:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me to recite Qur'an while bowing and to wear gold and garments dyed with safflower."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5175
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibrahim bin 'Abdullah bin Hunain that his father said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard 'Ali say: 'The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me- but I do not say that he forbade you- from wearing gold rings, Al-Qassi, and garments dyed with safflower, and reciting Qur'an while bowing.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5176
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me from rings of gold, garments dyed with safflower, and wearing Al-Qassi, and from reciting Qur'an while bowing."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5177
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn Hunain- the freed slave of Ibn 'Abbas- that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me from wearing Al-Qassi, garments dyed with safflower, and gold rings."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5178
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn Hunain, the freed slave of 'Ali, that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me from four: Gold rings, wearing Al-Qassi, reciting Qur'an while I am bowing, and from wearing garments dyed with safflower."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5179
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Nafi', from a freed slave of Ibn 'Abbas, that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me from wearing garments dyed with safflower, and from Al-Qassi, and from gold rings, and that I recite Qur'an while I am bowing."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5180
hadith_list.narrator: Ibn Hunain narrated that 'Ali said to him:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me (from wearing) garments dyed with safflower, and from gold rings, and from wearing Al-Qassi, and that I recite Qur'an while I am bowing."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5181
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Ali that :
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade (wearing) garments dyed with safflower, and Al-Qassiyah garments, and reciting Qur'an while he is bowing.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5182
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade" and he quoted the same Hadith.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5183
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet [SAW] forbade me from Al-Qassi, silk, gold rings, and that I recite Qur'an while bowing." Hisham contradicted him, he did not narrate it in Marfu' form.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5184
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Abidah, from 'Ali, he said:
hadith_list.english_text: "He forbade red Al-Mayathir, wearing Al-Qassi, and gold rings."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5185
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Abidah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "He forbade red Al-Mayathir, and gold rings."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5186
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me to wear gold rings."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5187
hadith_list.narrator: Hafs Al-Laithi said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I bear witness that 'Imran narrated to us, he said: 'The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade wearing silk, and gold rings, and drinking from Al-Hanatim.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5188
hadith_list.narrator: Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri narrated that:
hadith_list.english_text: A man came from Najran to the Messenger of Allah [SAW]. He was wearing a gold ring, and the Messenger of Allah [SAW] turned away from him, and said: "You have come to me with a coal of fire on your hand."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5189
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Al-Bara' bin 'Azib that :
hadith_list.english_text: A man was sitting with the Prophet [SAW] and he was wearing a gold ring. The Messenger of Allah [SAW] had a stick in his hand and the Prophet [SAW] struck his finger. The man said: "What's wrong with me, O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "Why don't you get rid of this thing that is on your finger?" The man took it and threw it away. The Prophet [SAW] saw him after that and said: "What happened to the ring?" He said: "I threw it away." He said: "I did not tell you to do that, rather I told you to sell it and benefit from its price." This Hadith is Munkar.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5190
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Tha'labah Al-Khushani that :
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] saw a gold ring on his hand, and he started to smack him with a stick that he had in his hand. When the Prophet [SAW] looked away, he threw it away. He said: "I think that he hurt you or we made you lose money."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5191
hadith_list.narrator: Abu Idris Al-Khawlani narrated that:
hadith_list.english_text: A man, among those who met the Prophet [SAW], wore a gold ring. A similar report.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5192
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Idris Al-Khawlani that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] saw a man wearing a gold ring. A similar report.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5193
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Idris that :
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] saw a gold ring on a man's hand and he struck his finger with a stick that he had with him, until he threw it away.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5194
hadith_list.narrator: Ibrahim bin Sa'd bin Shihab narrated that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW]...In Mursal form.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5195
hadith_list.narrator: 'Abdullah bin Buraidah narrated from his father that:
hadith_list.english_text: A man came to the Prophet [SAW] and he was wearing an iron ring. He said: "Why do I see you wearing the jewelry of the people of Hell?" He threw it away, then he came and he was wearing a brass ring. He said: "Why do I notice the stench of idols from you?" So he threw it away, and said: "O Messenger of Allah, what should I use?" He said: "Silver, but it should not equal a Mithqal."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5196
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Anas that :
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] wore a ring of silver with an Ethiopian stone (Fass), on which was inscribed (the phrase): "Muhammad Rasul Allah (Muhammad the Messenger of Allah)."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5197
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas bin Malik said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] had a ring of silver which he wore on his right hand. It had an Ethiopian stone (Fass), and he used to wear the stone (Fass) next to his palm."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5198
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas bin Malik said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The ring of the Messenger of Allah [SAW] was of silver and its stone (Fass) was made of silver too."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5199
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Anas that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet's ring was made of silver and its stone (Fass) was made of silver too.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5200
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The ring of the Prophet [SAW] was made of silver and its stone (Fass) was made of silver too."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5201
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] wanted to write to the Romans, but they (the Companions) said: 'They do not read any letter unless it has a seal.' So he took a ring of silver, and it is as if I can see its whiteness on his hand, and on it were engraved (the words): "Muhammad Rasul Allah (Muhammad the Messenger of Allah)."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5202
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] delayed 'Isha' prayer one night, until half the night had passed, then he came out and led us in prayer. And it is as if I can see the whiteness of his silver ring on his hand."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5203
hadith_list.narrator: Ibn Wahab narrated from Sulaiman - and he is Ibn Bilal - from Sharik - and he is Ibn Abi Namr - from Ibrahim Ibn 'Abdullah bin Hunain, from his father, from 'Ali; Sharik said:
hadith_list.english_text:
"And Abu Salamah informed me" -
That the Prophet [SAW] used to wear his ring on his right hand.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5204
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Abdullah bin Ja'far that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] used to wear his ring on his right hand.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5205
hadith_list.narrator: Iyas bin Al-Harith bin Al-Mu'aiqib narrated that his grandfather Mu'aiqib said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The ring of the Prophet [SAW] was made of iron with silver twisted around it." He said: "And sometimes it was on my hand." And Mu'aiqib was the keeper of the ring of the Messenger of Allah [SAW].

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5206
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri:
hadith_list.english_text: "A man came from Al-Bahrain to the Prophet [SAW] and greeted him with Salam, but he did not return his greeting. He was wearing a gold ring on his hand, and was wearing a silken Jubbah. He took them off, then he greeted him with Salam, and he returned his greeting. Then he said: 'O Messenger of Allah, I came to you just now, and you turned away from me.' He said: 'You had a coal of fire on your hand.' He said: 'Then I have brought many coals.' He said: 'What you have brought with you is no better for us than the stones of Al-Harrah, but it is a temporary convenience of this world.' He said: 'What should I use for a ring?' He said: 'A ring of iron or silver or brass.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5207
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] came out wearing a silver ring. He said: 'Whoever wants to make a ring like this, let him do so, but do not put the same inscription.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5208
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas bin Malik said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] put on a ring, and he had some words inscribed on it. He said: 'We have put on a ring and have had some words engraved on it; no one of you should copy this inscription.'" Then Anas said: "It is as if I can see its whiteness on his hand."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5209
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas bin Malik said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'Do not be so close to the Mushrikin that you can benefit from the light of their fires, and do not engrave Arabic (words) on your rings.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5210
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Burdah said:
hadith_list.english_text: 'Ali said: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said to me: 'O 'Ali, ask Allah for guidance and steadfastness,' and he forbade me from placing a ring on this one and this one' - and he pointed to his forefinger and middle finger.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5211
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me to wear a ring on this one and this one," meaning the forefinger and middle finger. And this is the wording of Ibn Al-Muthanna.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5212
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said to me: 'Say: O Allah, guide me and make me steadfast,' and he forbade me to put a ring on this one and this one" - and Bishr (one of the narrators) pointed to his forefinger and middle finger. And 'Asim said: "One of the two of them."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5213
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Anas that:
hadith_list.english_text: When entering the Khala', the Messenger of Allah [SAW] would take off his ring.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5214
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] put on a ring of gold and put its stone toward his palm. Then the people started to wear rings of gold. Then the Messenger of Allah [SAW] threw away his ring and said: 'I will never wear it again,' and the people threw away their rings."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5215
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn 'Umar that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] put on a ring of gold and put its stone (Fass) toward his palm. Then the people started to wear rings, and the Messenger of Allah [SAW] discarded it and said: "I will never wear it again."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5216
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet [SAW] used to wear a ring of gold, then he discarded it, and put on a ring of silver on which was engraved (the words): 'Muhammad Rasul Allah.' He said: 'No one else should engrave his ring with an inscription like this ring of mine.' Then he put the stone toward the palm of his hand."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5217
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn 'Umar that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] wore a ring of gold for three days, and when his Companions saw it, gold rings became popular. Then he threw it away and we did not realize what he had done. Then he ordered that a ring of silver be made, and that (the words): "Muhammad Rasul Allah" be engraved on it. It remained on the hand of the Messenger of Allah [SAW] until he died, then on the hand of Abu Bakr until he died, then on the hand of 'Umar until he died. Then (it remained) on the hand of 'Uthman for the first six years of his duties, but when he had to write many letters, he gave it to a man from among Ansar who used to seal letters with it. Then the Ansari went out to a well belonging to 'Uthman and the ring fell. They looked for it but could not find it. He ordered that a similar ring be made and engraved (the words): "Muhammad Rasul Allah" on it.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5218
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn 'Umar that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] put on a ring of gold, and he used to wear its stone (Fass) next to his palm. Then the people started to wear rings of gold. Then the Messenger of Allah [SAW] discarded it, and the people discarded their rings. Then he acquired a ring of silver with which he used to seal letters, but he did not wear it.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5219
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaikh said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I was sitting with Salim when a caravan belonging to Umm Al-Banin passed by us, and they had bells with them. Salim narrated to Nafi' from his father, that the Prophet [SAW] said: 'The angels do not accompany a caravan that has small bells with them.' How often do you see small bells with these people."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5220
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Bakr bin Musa said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I was with Salim bin 'Abdullah when Salim narrated from his father, that the Prophet [SAW] said: 'The angels do not accompany groups of people who have small bells with them.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5221
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Salim, from his father,:
hadith_list.english_text: Who attributed it to the Prophet [SAW]: "The angels do not accompany groups of people who have small bells with them."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5222
hadith_list.narrator: Umm Salamah, the wife of the Prophet [SAW], said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard the Messenger of Allah [SAW] say: 'The angels do not enter a house in which there is a small bell, or a bell, and the angels do not accompany groups of people who have bells with them.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5223
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Al-Ahwas that his father said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I was sitting with the Messenger of Allah [SAW] and he saw that I was dressed in scruffy clothes. He said: 'Do you have any wealth?' I said: 'Yes, O Messenger of Allah, all kinds of wealth.' He said: 'If Allah gives you wealth then let its effect be seen on you.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5224
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Al-Ahwas, from his father, :
hadith_list.english_text: That he came to the Prophet [SAW] wearing shabby clothes. The Prophet [SAW] said to him: "Do you have any wealth?" He said: "Yes, all kinds of wealth." He said: "What kinds of wealth?" He said: "Allah has given me camels, cattle, sheep, horses and slaves." He said: "If Allah has given you wealth, then let the effect of Allah's blessing and generosity be seen on you."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5225
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said to me: 'Five things are from the Fitrah: Trimming the mustache, plucking the armpit hairs, clipping the nails, shaving the pubes and circumcision.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5226
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn 'Umar that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] said: "Trim the mustache and let the beard grow."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5227
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Abdullah bin Ja'far said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] stayed away from the family of Ja'far (when he died) for three days, then he came to them, and said: 'Do not weep for my brother after today.' Then he said: 'Call my brother's sons to me.' We were brought like little chicks, and he said: 'Call the barber for me.' Then he ordered that our heads be shaved."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5228
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn 'Umar that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] forbade Al-Qaza' (shaving part of the head and leaving part).

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5229
hadith_list.narrator: Ibn 'Umar said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbidding Al-Qaza' (shaving part of the head and leaving part)."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5230
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade Al-Qaza' (shaving part of the head and leaving part)."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5231
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn 'Umar that :
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] forbade Al-Qaza' (shaving part of the head and leaving part)."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5232
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Al-Bara' said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] was a man of average height with broad shoulders, a thick beard and a reddish complexion, and his hair came down to his earlobes. I saw him in a red Hullah and I never saw anything more handsome than him."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5233
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Al-Bara' said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I never saw any long haired man in a Hullah who was more handsome than the Messenger of Allah [SAW], and he had hair that came down to his shoulders."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5234
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Anas that:
hadith_list.english_text: The hair of the Prophet [SAW] came halfway down his ears.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5235
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Anas that:
hadith_list.english_text: The hair of the Prophet [SAW] came down to his shoulders.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5236
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Jabir bin 'Abdullah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet [SAW] came to us and saw a man with wild hair. He said: 'Could this man not find anything with which to calm down his hair?'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5237
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Qatadah said:
hadith_list.english_text: That he had long thick hair. "He asked the Prophet (about it) and he told him to take care of it and comb it every day."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5238
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn 'Abbas that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] used to let his hair hang down (without a parting) and the Mushrikun used to part their hair. The Messenger of Allah [SAW] liked to act in accordance with the People of the Book, in matters where no specific command had been given to him. Then the Messenger of Allah [SAW] parted his hair after that.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5239
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Abdullah bin Buraidah that:
hadith_list.english_text: A man from among the Companions of the Prophet [SAW] who was called 'Ubaid said: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] used to forbid too much of Al-Irfah." Ibn Buraidah was asked what too much of Al-Irfah meant, and he said: "It includes combing the hair."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5240
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from 'Aishah that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] liked to start on the right whenever possible; when purifying himself, when putting on his shoes, and when combing his hair.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5241
hadith_list.narrator: Abu Hurairah narrated that :
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "The Jews and the Christians do not dye their hair, so be different from them."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5242
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Jabir said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Abu Quhafah was brought to the Messenger of Allah [SAW] and his head and beard were white like the Thaghamah. The Prophet [SAW] said: 'Change this, or dye it.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5243
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Ubaid said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I saw Ibn 'Umar dyeing his beard yellow and I asked him about that. 'He said: "I saw the Prophet [SAW] dye his beard yellow."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5244
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet [SAW] used to wear Sibtiyyah sandals and dye his beard yellow with Wars and saffron." And Ibn 'Umar used to do that.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5245
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Humaid bin 'Abdur-Rahman said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard Mu'awiyah say, when he was on the Minbar in Al-Madinah, and he brought out a hairpiece from his sleeve: 'O people of Al-Madinah, where are your knowledgeable ones? I heard the Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbid such things as this, and he said: "The Children of Israel were destroyed when their women started to wear things like this."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5246
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Sa'eed bin Al-Musayyab said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Mu'awiyah came to Al-Madinah and addressed us. He took hold of a hairpiece and said: 'I never used to see anyone do this except the Jews. The Messenger of Allah [SAW] heard of it and he called it "giving a false impression."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5247
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Mu'awiyah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "O people, the Prophet [SAW] forbade you to give false impressions. He brought a piece of black cloth and threw it in front of them and said: 'This is what women are putting on their heads and covering it.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5248
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Mu'awiyah that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade giving a false impression, and the false impression of a woman when she adds extra hair to her head.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5249
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn 'Umar that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] cursed the woman who affixes hair extensions.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5250
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Asma' that:
hadith_list.english_text: A woman came to the Messenger of Allah [SAW] and said: "O Messenger of Allah [SAW], a daughter of mine is going to get married. She got sick and her hair fell out. Is there any sin on me if I give her hair extensions?" He said: "Allah has cursed the woman who affixes hair extensions and the one who has that done."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5251
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] cursed the woman who affixes hair extensions and the one who has that done, and the woman who does tattoos and the one who has that done."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5252
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Abdullah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "May Allah curse Al-Mutanammisat and who have their teeth separated. Shall I not curse those whom the Messenger of Allah [SAW] cursed?"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5253
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Abdullah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] cursed the women who do tattoos, those who have their teeth separated and Al-Mutanammisat who change the creation of Allah, the Mighty and Sublime."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5254
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Abdullah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "May Allah curse Al-Mutanammisat and their teeth separated, who have tattoos done, changing the creation of Allah." A woman came to him and said: "Are you the one who said such-and-such?" He said: "Why should I not say what the Messenger of Allah [SAW] said?"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5255
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibrahim said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Abdullah used to say: 'May Allah curse the women who have tattoos done and Al-Mutanammisat, and have the women who have their teeth separated. Should I not curse those whom the Messenger of Allah [SAW] cursed?'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5256
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade men to use saffron."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5257
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah (ï·º) forbade men to use saffron on their skin."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5258
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas bin Malik said:
hadith_list.english_text: "If perfume was brought to the Prophet [SAW], he would not refuse it."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5259
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "Whoever is offered perfume, let him not refuse it for it is easy to carry, and smells good."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5260
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Zainab, the wife of 'Abdullah, said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'If one of you (women) wants to attend 'Isha' (prayer). Let her not touch any perfume.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5261
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Busr bin Sa'eed that Zainab, the wife of 'Abdullah, told him that :
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said to her: "If you go out to 'Isha' then do not touch any perfume."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5262
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Zainab Ath-Thaqafiyyah that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] said: "Any one of you (women) who wants to go out to the Masjid should not go near any perfume."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5263
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that :
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "Any woman who has been perfumed with incense should not attend 'Isha' the later with us."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5264
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Sa'eed said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet [SAW] mentioned a woman who filled her ring with musk and said: 'That is the best of perfume.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5265
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Musa that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: "Allah has permitted silk and gold to the females of my Ummah, and has forbidden them to the males."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5266
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibn 'Abbas said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I was forbidden to wear red garments and gold rings, and to recite Qur'an when bowing."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5267
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet [SAW] forbade me from wearing gold rings, reciting Qur'an while I am bowing, and from Al-Qassi, and garments dyed with safflower."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5268
hadith_list.narrator: 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me from wearing gold rings, and from garments of Al-Qassi, and garments dyed with safflower, and reciting Qur'an while bowing."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5269
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me from reciting Qur'an while bowing."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5270
hadith_list.narrator: 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me from wearing garments dyed with safflower, and from gold rings, and from wearing Al-Qassi, and that I recite Qur'an while I am bowing."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5271
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me from four things: Wearing garments dyed with safflower, and from wearing gold rings, and from wearing Al-Qassiyah garments, and reciting Qur'an while I am bowing."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5272
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn Hunain, that 'Ali said that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade garments dyed with safflower, and from silk, and reciting Qur'an while he is bowing, and from gold rings.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5273
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] forbade gold rings.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5274
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade gold rings.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5275
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] took a ring of gold and put it on, and the people started to wear gold rings too. The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'I used to wear this ring, but I will never wear it again.' Then he threw it away, and the people threw their rings away."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5276
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The inscription on the ring of the Messenger of Allah [SAW] was: Muhammad Rasul Allah (Muhammad the Messenger of Allah).'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5277
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Anas that :
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] put on a silver ring with and Ethiopian stone (Fass), on which the inscription was: "Muhammad Rasul Allah."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5278
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] wanted to write to the Romans, and they (the Companions) said: 'They do not read any letter unless it has a seal.' So he took a ring of silver and it is as if I can see its whiteness on his hand, and engraved on it (were the words): 'Muhammad Rasul Allah.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5279
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Anas that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] put on a ring of silver with an Ethiopian stone (Fass).

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5280
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The ring of the Prophet [SAW] was of silver, and its stone (Fass) was made of silver too."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5281
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] said: 'We have had a ring made with an inscription, and no one else should copy this inscription.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5282
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Anas that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] had a ring and he said: "We have had a ring made with an inscription, and no one else should copy this inscription." It is as if I can see its shining on the little finer of the Messenger of Allah [SAW].

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5283
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Anas that:
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet [SAW] used to wear his ring on his right hand.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5284
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Anas said:
hadith_list.english_text: "It is as if I can see the whiteness of the Prophet's ring on his left finger."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5285
hadith_list.narrator: Thabit narrated that :
hadith_list.english_text: They asked Anas about the ring of the Messenger of Allah [SAW] and he said: "It is as if I can see the shining of his silver ring, and he raised his left little finger."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5286
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Abu Burdah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard 'Ali say: 'The Prophet of Allah [SAW] forbade me to wear a ring on the forefinger and middle finger.'"

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5287
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that 'Ali said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Messenger of Allah [SAW] forbade me to wear (a ring) on this finger," and it was on the middle finger and the one next to it.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5288
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated that Ibn 'Umar said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet [SAW] wore a ring of gold, then he discarded it and wore a ring of silver on which were engraved (the words) 'Muhammad Rasul Allah.' Then he said: 'No one should copy this inscription of mine.' And he wore the stone (Fass) toward his palm."

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5289
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn 'Abbas that :
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah [SAW] took a ring and put it on, then he said: "This distracted me from you all day, shifting my gaze from it to you (and back again)." Then he threw it away.

hadith_list.title: Sunan an-Nasa'i 5290
hadith_list.narrator: It was narrated from Ibn 'Umar that:
